definition: to shake/to vibrate/to jolt/to quake/excited/shocked/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing thunder/☳

sentences.chinese: 亚拉伯罕林肯总统异常震怒。

sentences.english: In his wrath the Lord will swallow them up, and his fire will consume them.
sentences.chinese: 耶和华要在他的震怒中吞灭他们。

sentences.english: A king's wrath is a messenger of death, and whoever is wise will appease it.
sentences.chinese: 王的震怒如杀人的使者，但智慧人能止息王怒。

sentences.english: China's netizens erupted with rage and hundreds of amateur sleuths traced the video to Hangzhou.
sentences.chinese: 中国网民震怒，数百名业余侦探查出视频来源。

sentences.english: There will be great distress in the land and wrath against this people.
sentences.chinese: 因为将有大灾难降在这地方，也有震怒临到这百姓。

sentences.english: When the Jade Emperor saw the rain, he was furious.
sentences.chinese: 当玉帝看到雨，他十分震怒。

sentences.english: Wen Guoxuan know the original literature to Chen Zhongqiang court relief, and infuriated.
sentences.chinese: 文国轩知道原来是文学庭向陈忠强救助，而大为震怒。

sentences.english: The old lady was very angry about the impoliteness the young man showed to her.
sentences.chinese: 老夫人对这个年轻人对她表现出的无礼态度大为震怒。

definition: to be furious/to fly into a terrible rage
to fly into a rage/to rage violently
unable to restrain one's anger (idiom); in a towering rage
to denounce/to condemn/to call to account/to punish
to hate and resent/angry and full of grievances
against orders/to disobey/to refuse to accept orders
